Dear Sharon Renee Berkobien:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909

Sincerely,

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff 1 slapped Youth C across the face and caused a red mark.
Investigation I spoke to Administrator 1 on 2/16/24; allegations were
discussed. No new information was provided.
I spoke to DHHS Worker 1. Scheduling was discussed. No new
information was shared.
I sent an email to FCW 1. No new information was provided that
pertained to the investigation.
I spoke to Complaint 1. No new information was provided.
All interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on
2/23/24. DHHS Worker 1 was not available, so interviews were
completed separately.
Staff 1
Staff 1 reported on 2/15/24, school was cancelled due to weather.
Staff 1 reported he was working with Staff 2 and Staff 3. The staff
took the youth into the unit living room. Youth A, Youth B, and
Youth C were attempting to get into their rooms and Staff 1
reported he told them they were not allowed. All three youth left
the living room and went to the end of the hallway. Staff 1 followed
them and Staff 2 sat in the hallway outside the living area, with a
direct line of sight of Staff 1 and the three youth. Staff 3 stayed in
the living area with the other youth. Staff 1 reported there was a
mop bucket with water at the end of the hallway and the youth
poured the water out onto his shoes and the floor. The youth
began throwing wet paper towels at Staff 1 and blocking him from
moving. Staff 1 reported he redirected the youth but they would
2

not listen. Youth C then picked up a paper towel and threw it at
Staff 1 and slipped on the floor. Staff 1 reported he picked up the
paper towel and threw it back at Youth C. Staff 1 reported he was
then able to get by the youth. Staff 1 reported he did not slap
Youth C in the face but did throw the wet paper towel back at him
and hit him in the face with it.
Staff 2
Staff 2 reported school was cancelled on 2/15/24 and the youth
were to go into the living area of the unit. Staff 2 reported some
youth wanted to go to their rooms and Staff 1 told them they could
not. The youth then walked down the hallway and Staff 1 followed
them. Staff 1 reported he stayed out in the hallway due to some
youth in the living room wanting to leave the unit. Staff 2 reported
he sat in front of the doorway. Staff 2 reported that Youth A, Youth
B, and Youth C were throwing mop water on Staff 1 and were not
listening to him. Staff 2 reported the youth were throwing wet
paper towels at Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 never raised his
voice and consistently asked the youth to stop “touching him.”
Youth C threw a paper towel that hit Staff 1 and slipped on the
floor. Staff 2 reported he saw Staff 1 squat down and slap him with
his hand. He then heard all the youth say, “We are going to get
you fired.” Staff 2 reported Staff 1 then left the hallway. Staff 2
reported he has never had any issues with Staff 1 before.
Staff 3:
Staff 3 reported she did not see the incident but did hear the youth
name calling Staff 1. Staff 3 reported that Staff 1 is a good staff
member. He sets limits and does not get upset with the youth.
Staff 3 reported she never heard Staff 1 raise his voice during the
incident, only was told by Youth C that Staff 1 hit him.
Youth C:
Youth C reported he was in the unit hallway with Youth A and
Youth B, and he was throwing wet paper towels at Staff 1. Youth
C reported when he threw the paper towel he fell on the ground
because it was wet due to the mop water on the ground. Youth C
reported Staff 1 was asking them to stop, but they did not do so.
Youth C reported after he fell, Staff 1 slapped him with an open
hand across his face. Youth C reported Staff 1 then left.
Youth B:
Youth B reported Youth A and Youth C were in the unit hallway
with Staff 1. Youth B reported they were “crowding” Staff 1 so he
could not get through them. Youth B reported they were “messing”
with him by pouring water on his shoes and the floor. Youth B
3

reported they also threw wet paper towels at Staff 1. When Youth
C threw a wet paper towel, he slipped on the floor. Youth B
reported Staff 1 picked up the wet paper towel and threw it at
Youth C, which hit him in the face and accidently knocked Youth
C’s glasses off.
There were no DHHS findings in their investigation.
Video Footage:
I watched the video on 2/15/24, from 9:21am-9:22:44am. Staff 1
did not slap Youth C with his hand but did throw a wet paper towel
at Youth C’s face, causing Youth C’s glasses to fall off his face.
The wet paper towel did hit Youth C in the face.
Documents:
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. All trainings and
clearances were up to date. There was no disciplinary
action in the file.
• I reviewed the incident report dated 2/15/24. The incident is
comparative to the interviews.
• Reviewed policy that prohibits physical punishment.
Analysis Staff 1 admitted to throwing a wet paper towel at Youth C. Video
observation reveals he did throw this wet paper towel at Youth C
and hit him in the face with it, knocking his glasses off of his face.
Video does not show Staff 1 slapping Youth C across the face
with his bare hand. Staff 1 does acknowledge that he did throw
the wet paper towel at Youth C.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
